required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Nurse-Family Partnership Impact Evaluation in South Carolina
clinical_study.official_title: Nurse-Family Partnership Impact Evaluation in South Carolina

collaborator.agency: Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the effects of the Nurse Family Partnership (NFP), an established home-visiting program, using a scientifically rigorous individual-level randomized controlled trial. The study will be based in South Carolina, where a Medicaid waiver in combination with a pay-for-success contract will allow expansion of the program to women on Medicaid. The study plans to enroll 4000 low-income, first time mothers and their children into the intervention group, and another 2000 into the control group. The study will evaluate the program's impacts on outcomes using administrative records. This study aims to yield new evidence on the effect of NFP in a modern context, applied to a new population, across a broad range of outcomes, and financed by a novel public-private partnership based on accountability for outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is an individual-level randomized controlled trial, with randomization post-consent. The study will enroll pregnant women who are income-eligible for Medicaid, less than 28 weeks pregnant, and have not had a previous live birth. All eligible applicants who provide written consent will be randomly assigned either to a treatment group that is offered access to NFP or to a control group that is not. Two-thirds of those recruited will be randomized to the treatment group and one-third to the control group. Control group members will have access to the standard of care and whatever other programs and services are available in the community.
The investigators will assess the effect of NFP on a range of short- and long-run maternal and child outcomes using administrative data that will be available for all members of both treatment and control groups. Several of the outcomes the investigators will evaluate are required as part of the Medicaid waiver and pay-for-success financing model.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The Nurse-Family Partnership (NFP) was launched by pediatrician David Olds in the early 1970s in response to the observation that low-income mothers are less likely to engage in positive health and parenting behaviors that are associated with better child development outcomes (Olds et al. 1986). NFP is a prenatal and infancy home visiting program for low-income, first-time mothers and their families. Registered nurses begin visiting their clients as early in the pregnancy as possible, helping the mother-to-be make informed choices. The nurses continue visiting regularly until the child is two years old.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 0-7 days after birth; vital records, mortality records, and fetal death records
primary_outcome.description: Composite of at least one of: small for gestational (SGA), or low birth weight (LBW) less than 2500 grams, preterm birth (PTB) less than 37 weeks' gestation (obstetric estimate), or perinatal mortality (fetal death at or after 20 weeks of gestation or mortality in the first 7 days of life)

primary_outcome.measure: Major injury or concern for abuse or neglect
primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months postpartum; Medicaid claims or hospital discharge data
primary_outcome.description: Composite of at least one health care encounter or mortality associated with ICD codes indicating either major injury, or, concern for abuse or neglect
Having a subsequent birth within the first 21 months of the index birth

secondary_outcome.description: Infant birth weight below the 10th percentile for infants of the same gestational age
Infant birth weight above the 90th percentile for infants of the same gestational age
Infant born with a birth weight of less than 2500 grams
Infant born with a birth weight of less than 1500 grams
A continuous measure of infant birth weight (grams)
Infant born before 37 weeks' gestation (obstetric estimate)
Infant born before 28 weeks' gestation
Gestational age at birth in weeks (continuous)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month postpartum; mortality records and fetal death records
secondary_outcome.description: Fetal death at or after 20 weeks of gestation or mortality in the first 7 days of life

secondary_outcome.measure: NICU admission of at least overnight
secondary_outcome.description: Infant admitted to the neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) for at least one night
Assisted ventilation immediately after delivery, assisted ventilation for more than six hours, seizure, receipt of surfactant replacement therapy, and receipt of antibiotics for suspected sepsis.
Cesarean delivery
As defined by the CDC
Death of mother within one year postpartum

secondary_outcome.measure: Neonatal abstinence disorder (NAS) or maternal drug/substance abuse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Two years postpartum; Medicaid claims, hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Evidence of NAS or maternal drug or substance abuse in first two years postpartum

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal experience of violence or homicide
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months postpartum; Medicaid claims, mortality records
secondary_outcome.description: Includes any ICD code for healthcare encounter associated with experiencing violence or mortality associated with homicide based on ICD code
Postpartum visit in first 12 weeks after birth
Adequacy of Prenatal Care Utilization Index (APNCU)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of emergency department visits during pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Number of emergency department visits during pregnancy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At birth; Medicaid claims and dental records
secondary_outcome.description: Dental visit during pregnancy (preventive or treatment)
Ultrasound at 18-22 weeks (anatomy scan)

Obstetric panel (D (Rh), RBC antibody screen, CBC, urine culture, urinalysis), STI screenings (HIV, Syphilis, Hep B, Chlamydia if <25, gonorrhea if <25), Group B screening, Glucose screening at 24-28 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Mental health diagnosis or outpatient treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During pregnancy or 60 days postpartum; Medicaid claims
secondary_outcome.description: Diagnosis for depression/anxiety/stress reaction or antidepressant prescription or outpatient mental health visit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During pregnancy or 60 days postpartum; Medicaid claims
secondary_outcome.description: Diagnosis of depression/anxiety/stress reaction

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During pregnancy or 60 days postpartum; Medicaid claims
secondary_outcome.description: Antidepressant prescription

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During pregnancy or 60 days postpartum; Medicaid claims
secondary_outcome.description: Outpatient mental health visit

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 120 days of treatment initiation; Medicaid claims
secondary_outcome.description: Second antidepressant prescription or outpatient mental health visit within 120 days of treatment initiation ("acute phase")

secondary_outcome.measure: Any mental health related emergency/inpatient visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During pregnancy or 12 months postpartum; Hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Based on all-listed diagnoses (i.e. primary or secondary) for depression/anxiety/stress reaction

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of mental health related emergency/inpatient visits
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During pregnancy or 12 months postpartum; Hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Based on all-listed diagnoses (i.e. primary or secondary) for depression/anxiety/stress reaction

secondary_outcome.measure: Health care encounter or mortality associated with ICD codes indicating major injury
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months of life; Medicaid claims, hospital discharge, mortality records
secondary_outcome.description: Child experiences a major injury

secondary_outcome.measure: Health care encounter or mortality associated with ICD codes indicating concern for abuse or neglect
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months of life; Medicaid claims, hospital discharge, mortality records
secondary_outcome.description: Concern for abuse or neglect of child
Number of injuries

secondary_outcome.measure: Any emergency department visit for child
secondary_outcome.description: Child visit to the emergency department
Total number of child visits to the emergency department
All-cause child mortality in first 24 months of life
Proportion of recommended well-child visits
Child receives at least one lead screening
Child receives at least one developmental screening

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months; Medicaid claims and dental records
secondary_outcome.description: Child visits the dentist at least once in first 24 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months; Medicaid claims and dental records
secondary_outcome.description: Share of recommended fluoride treatments received by child
Having a subsequent birth within the first 24 months of the index birth
Having a subsequent birth within the first 21 months of the index birth
Continuous measure of inter-birth interval

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks postpartum; Medicaid claims, hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Any family planning-related counseling or service

secondary_outcome.measure: Received a highly or moderately effective method of contraception (6 weeks)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks postpartum; Medicaid claims, hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Received implant, IPP-LARC, LARC, or sterilization and moderately effective contraception to include path, ring, diaphragm, injectables and contraceptive pills

secondary_outcome.measure: Received immediate postpartum long-acting reversible contraception (6 weeks)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 6 weeks postpartum; Medicaid claims, hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Received Immediate postpartum long-acting reversible contraception in first 6 weeks postpartum

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months postpartum; Medicaid claims, hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Any family planning-related counseling or service

secondary_outcome.measure: Received a highly or moderately effective method of contraception (1 year)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months postpartum; Medicaid claims, hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Received implant, IPP-LARC, LARC, or sterilization and moderately effective contraception to include path, ring, diaphragm, injectables and contraceptive pills

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months postpartum; Medicaid claims, hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Postpartum intrauterine device insertion in first 12 months postpartum

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to first take-up of family planning counseling or service
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months postpartum; Medicaid claims, hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Months from pregnancy to first take up of family planning counseling or service

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to first take-up of highly effective contraceptive method
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 months postpartum; Medicaid claims, hospital discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Months from discharge to first take up of highly effective contraceptive method (include implant, IPP-LARC, LARC, or sterilization)

arm_group.description: NFP is a prenatal and infancy home visiting program for low-income, first-time mothers and their families. Registered nurses begin visiting their clients as early in the pregnancy as possible, helping the mother-to-be make informed choices. The nurses continue visiting regularly until the child is two years old.
Control group members have access to the standard of care and whatever other programs and services are available in the community.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female
- No previous live births
- Currently pregnant
- Gestation period less than 28 weeks (i.e. less than or equal to 27 weeks, 6 days) at time of recruitment
- Ages 15-55
- Income level meets Medicaid eligibility criteria
- Live within an area serviced by a NFP Implementing Agency
- Not currently enrolled in the study
- Not incarcerated or living in lock down facilities
Exclusion Criteria:
- Men
- Women who have had a previous live birth
- Women who are not currently pregnant
- Women who are past their 28th week of gestation (i.e. greater than or equal to 28 weeks, 0 days) at time of recruitment
- Women who are younger than 15 or older than 55 years of age
- Women whose income level does not meet Medicaid eligibility criteria
- Women who live outside of an area serviced by a NFP Implementing Agency
- Women who are currently enrolled in the study
- Women who are currently incarcerated or living in a lock down facility

facility.name: Family Solutions of the Lowcountry NFP

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associate Professor of Global Health Economics
